com.jidesoft.swing
Interface LayoutPersistence

All Known Subinterfaces:
DockableBarManager, DockingManager
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractLayoutPersistence, DefaultDockableBarManager, DefaultDockingManager
public interface LayoutPersistence

An interface to support persist layout.

Method Summary

          Starts a process to add/remove frame or dockable bar without showing on screen immediately.

Method Detail

setProfileKey

public void setProfileKey(java.lang.String key)
Sets profile key. Profile key is used in registry (on Windows) or folder name (on UNIX or Linux, prefix with ".") allowing data to be stored in.

Parameters:
key -

getAvailableLayouts

public java.util.List getAvailableLayouts()
Gets the list of available layout names. If usePref is true and profileKey has been set, the method will return the list of save layouts in user preference. If not, it will find out the layout file in user home directory.

Returns:
the list of available layout names.

isLayoutAvailable

public boolean isLayoutAvailable(java.lang.String layoutName)
Checks if the layout is available.

Parameters:
layoutName -
Returns:
true if the layout is available

removeLayout

public void removeLayout(java.lang.String layoutName)
Removes the layout. If usePref is true, the layout will be removed from user preference. Or else, the corresponding layout file will be deleted.

Parameters:
layoutName -

loadLayoutData

public void loadLayoutData()
Load layout from default layout data from profile.

loadLayoutDataFrom

public void loadLayoutDataFrom(java.lang.String layoutName)
Load layout data from the profile name specified in layoutName. Note: Always use all lower case. I found some problems with upper case on Windows.

Parameters:
layoutName - profile name to be used

loadLayoutDataFromFile

public void loadLayoutDataFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Loads layout from default layout data from a file.

loadLayoutFrom

public void loadLayoutFrom(java.io.InputStream in)
Load layout data from an InputStream that specified as in parameter. If any exception happens during the read, it will call resetLayout() to use default layout.

Parameters:
in - the InputStream where the layout data will be read from.

saveLayoutData

public void saveLayoutData()
Save layout data to default profile.

saveLayoutDataAs

public void saveLayoutDataAs(java.lang.String layoutName)
Save layout data to profile that specified in layoutName Note: Always use all lower case. I found some problems with upper case on Windows.

Parameters:
layoutName -

saveLayoutDataToFile

public void saveLayoutDataToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Save layout data to file that specified in fileName. The fileName should be full qualified file name. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.

Parameters:
fileName -

saveLayoutTo

public void saveLayoutTo(java.io.OutputStream out)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Save layout data to an OutputStream that specified as out parameter.

Parameters:
out - the OutputStream where the layout data will be written to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getLayoutData

public java.lang.String getLayoutData()
Gets frame arrangement information as a String. You can keep the value returned and pass it in to setLayoutData to put the frame.

Returns:
layout data

setLayoutData

public void setLayoutData(java.lang.String layoutData)
Change layout.

Parameters:
layoutData - the string that returned from getLayoutData

getVersion

public short getVersion()
Gets version number of profile.

Returns:
version of profile

setVersion

public void setVersion(short version)
Sets version number of profile. User can set a new version so that application restart, it will ignore previous layout information.

Parameters:
version - new version

setUsePref

public void setUsePref(boolean use)
If true, use javax.uitl.pref to store dockable bars layout data. The setting only has effect on Windows. On UNIX or Linux, javax.util.pref is never used because it has problem to store binary data

Parameters:
use - use javax pref or not. Default is true

getLayoutDirectory

public java.lang.String getLayoutDirectory()
Gets the directory that used for storing layout files. It is used only when setUsePref is false.

Returns:
the directory so store layout files.

setLayoutDirectory

public void setLayoutDirectory(java.lang.String layoutDirectory)
Sets the layout directory. Layout directory is used to store layout files only when setUsePref is false.

Parameters:
layoutDirectory -

resetToDefault

public void resetToDefault()
Resets layout. It could be called either when there is no saved layout or the saved layout file is corrupted.

setUseFrameState

public void setUseFrameState(boolean saveMainFrameState)
If true, the state of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

Parameters:
saveMainFrameState - true if the state of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

setUseFrameBounds

public void setUseFrameBounds(boolean saveMainFrameBounds)
If true, the bounds of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

Parameters:
saveMainFrameBounds - true if the bounds of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

beginLoadLayoutData

public void beginLoadLayoutData()
Starts a process to add/remove frame or dockable bar without showing on screen immediately. Any call to loadLayoutDataXxx methods or resetToDefault() will mark the process.
